ca.uhn.fhir.model.dev.resource

Class AdverseReactionRisk.Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uhn.fhir.model.api.BaseElement
      • ca.uhn.fhir.model.api.BaseIdentifiableElement
        • ca.uhn.fhir.model.dev.resource.AdverseReactionRisk.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICompositeElement, IElement, IIdentifiableElement, IResourceBlock, ISupportsUndeclaredExtensions
    Enclosing class:
    AdverseReactionRisk

    public static class AdverseReactionRisk.Event
extends BaseIdentifiableElement
implements IResourceBlock
    Block class for child element: AdverseReactionRisk.event (Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance)

    Definition: Details about each Adverse Reaction Event linked to exposure to the identified Substance

      • getSubstance

        public BoundCodeableConceptDt<SubstanceTypeEnum> getSubstance()
        Gets the value(s) for substance (Specific substance considered to be responsible for event). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: Identification of the specific substance considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different to the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite substance that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the AdverseReactionRisk.substance and ignore the AdverseReactionRisk.event.substance

      • setSubstance

        public AdverseReactionRisk.Event setSubstance(BoundCodeableConceptDt<SubstanceTypeEnum> theValue)
        Sets the value(s) for substance (Specific substance considered to be responsible for event)

        Definition: Identification of the specific substance considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different to the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite substance that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the AdverseReactionRisk.substance and ignore the AdverseReactionRisk.event.substance

      • setSubstance

        public AdverseReactionRisk.Event setSubstance(SubstanceTypeEnum theValue)
        Sets the value(s) for substance (Specific substance considered to be responsible for event)

        Definition: Identification of the specific substance considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different to the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite substance that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the AdverseReactionRisk.substance and ignore the AdverseReactionRisk.event.substance

      • getCertaintyElement

        public BoundCodeDt<AdverseReactionRiskCertaintyEnum> getCertaintyElement()
        Gets the value(s) for certainty (unlikely | likely | confirmed - clinical certainty about the specific substance). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: Statement about the degree of clinical certainty that the Specific Substance was the cause of the Manifestation in this reaction event
